resources.string: An exception occurred. Share infos using…

Enabling this makes it possible to automate the freezing of apps.

This has the following advantages:
 - The user does not have to do this himself: It is way faster and the user does not have to care about how to do it.
 - Users with physical disabilities just need to start the shortcut "autofreeze" (by speech recognition, for example). Then they can freeze all apps automatically. 

SuperFreezZ just uses the accessibility service to tap on "Force Stop", "OK", "Back" and to evaluate the result of these interactions.
Freeze this app if it has not been used for a longer time.
UsageStats access makes it possible for SuperFreezZ to freeze apps only if you did not use them for some time (AUTO FREEZE).
You did not enable usagestats access.
For users who: \n\u2022 want to have it as easy as possible \n\u2022 want to freeze a lot of apps

You will have to press "FORCE STOP", "OK" and Back manually to freeze an app.
For users who: 
• have a slow phone 
• care a lot about security 
• do not want to register SuperFreezZ as an accessibility service
SuperFreezZ makes it easy to entirely freeze all background activities of apps.
There are 3 freeze modes. You can choose one for every app. ALWAYS FREEZE will freeze an app in any case.
NEVER FREEZE will - turn off freezing and never freeze an app.
AUTO FREEZE will freeze an app only if it has not been used for some time (7 days by default)
